_header: Christ that art both day and light
Subjects: Christ, attributes of; hymns, to Christ; paraphrases
_description: John Lydgate’s version of the hymn ‘Criste qui lux es et dies’ — seven 8-line stanzas with Latin cauda as headings to each stanza

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Cryst þat art booþe daye and lightAnd sooþefaaste
                    sonne of al gladnesseÞat doost awey derknesse of nightAnd
                    souereyne light of al brightnesse…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…for which wee sing in Ioye and woodeo patri sit
                    gloria
